ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Observation data at 2.1 km height derived from CAPPI observation (GIF format)
ResourceHeader.Description: The two-dimensional plot of rain cloud distribution estimated from the X-band weather radar at Kototabang in West Sumatra, Indonesia (0.20S, 100.32E, 865m MSL), which has been operated since September 23, 2002. This plot shows a spatial distribution of reflective energy flux from rain clouds at 2.1 km height within a 30 km circular region at the center of radar location. The unit of reflective energy flux is dBZ. File names are composed of (year)(month)(day).(hour)(minute)(second).gif. Local time (UT + 7h) is used for time data.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: If you acquire X-band radar data, we ask that you acknowledge us in your use of the data. This may be done by including text such as X-band radar data provided by Shimane University and Research Institute for Sustainable Humanosphere (RISH) of Kyoto University. We would also appreciate receiving a copy of the relevant publications.

AccessURL.Name: Rain distribution observed with an X-band Radar at Equatorial Atmosphere Observatory

Parameter.Name: year
Parameter.Description: Year in the form YYYY where YYYY = Gregorian Year AD.

Parameter.Name: month
Parameter.Description: Month in the form MMM where MMM = month of year (Jan, Feb,..., Dec).

Parameter.Name: day
Parameter.Description: Day in the form DD where DD = day of month (01-31).

Parameter.Name: time
Parameter.Description: Time in the form hh:mm:ss where hh = hour of day (0-23). mm = minute of hour (00-59) and ss = second of minute (00-59). Local time (UT+07:00:00) is used for time data.

Parameter.Name: Reflective energy flux
Parameter.Description: Reflective energy flux from rain field within a 30 km circular region at the center of radar location
